intro: Zeuxine seidenfadenii, commonly known as the Sunda zeuxine, is a flowering plant belonging to the Ranunculaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in the tropical regions of Indonesia and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its delicate, herbaceous stems and clusters of small, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a soft, velvety texture. Zeuxine seidenfadenii thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
